original_title: Slim Tactile Switches Save Classic TI Calculator with a Bad Keypad
original_content:
For vintage calculator fans, nothing strikes more fear than knowing that someday their precious and irreplaceable daily driver will become a museum piece to be looked at and admired  but never touched again. More often than not, the failure mode will be the keypad.
In an effort to recover from the inevitable, at least for 70s vintage TI calculators, [George] has come up with these nice replacement keypad PCBs. The original membrane switches on these calculators have a limited life, but luckily there are ultra-slim SMD tactile switches these days make a dandy substitute. [George] specifies a 0.8 mm thick switch that when mounted on a 1.6 mm thick PCB comes in just a hair over the original keypads 2.2 mm thickness. He has layouts for a TI-45, which should also fit a TI-30, and one for the larger keypads on TI-58s and TI-59s.
While these particular calculators might not in your collection, [George]s goal is to create an open source collection of replacement keypads for all the vintage calculators sitting in desk drawers out there. And not just keypads, but battery packs, too.
title: ヴィンテージ電卓の修理に役立つ交換キーパッドPCB
body: ビンテージ電卓ファンにとって、使い古した電卓のキーパッドの故障は恐れられている。70年代のTI電卓には、Georgeさんが置き換え用のキーパッドPCBを作成。老朽化したメンブレンスイッチはSMDタクタイルスイッチで代替可能。Georgeさんはオープンソースで他の電卓向けにも作成予定。
